japanese:
上杉君、あなたという人は、
どうしてそうも鈍感なのですか？
もう少し、相手のことを考えてください。
translation:
Uesugi-kun, you are just SO insensitive.
You should be more considerate.

japanese:
えええええ、ホントわからない！
もう１回、お願いしていい？
translation:
Wooow, I really can't tell the difference!
Do it one more time, please!

japanese:
やはり、らいはちゃんは可愛すぎです！
どうにかして私の妹にできないですかね？
translation:
Oh my goodness, you're just too cute, Raiha-chan!
Is there really no way I can make you my little sister?

japanese:
三玖……。
お前、何を言ってるんだ？
translation:
Miku...
What are you saying?

japanese: え、フータロー！？
translation: Huh, Futaro?!

japanese:
あ、お兄ちゃん！
今ね、三玖さんにみんなの真似してもらってたの。
translation:
Ah, big bro!
We just had Miku do impressions of everyone.

japanese: まあ、そんなことだろうと思ったが。
translation: Yeah, that's what I thought.

japanese:
さすが五つ子だよね。
初めて会ったときも驚いちゃったけど、
話し方まで真似されたら見分けつかないよ。
translation:
Quintuplets are amazing! If you imitate
the way each other speaks, I can't tell you apart.

japanese:
みんなとはよく入れ替わってたから。
しゃべり方も完璧だと思う。
translation:
We often stand in for each other,
so we can imitate each other perfectly.

japanese:
はっ！？
もしかして、その特技を使えば……
お１人様１パック限りのたまごを５回買えるかも！
translation:
Huh?! Maybe with your unique skill...
You could buy that one-per-person discount on a pack of eggs five times!

japanese: 同一人物と勘違いされるだけだな。
translation: They'd just mistake her for the same person.

japanese: うん、真似してなくても間違われるし。
translation:
Yes, even if we're not imitating each other,
people still get us confused.

japanese:
そっか、残念。
似すぎてるのも大変なんだね。
translation:
Oh, that's too bad.
It must be complicated to look alike, huh?

japanese:
カツラや小物まで使って変装されたら
もっとわからなくなるぞ。
何回だまされたことか……。
translation:
If they use wigs and accessories to disguise themselves,
it gets even harder to tell them apart.
Just how many times have I been deceived...?

japanese: 影武者は見破られたら負けだから。
translation:
If anyone realizes that it's a body double, it'll be over 
for us.

japanese:
そういえば、温泉旅行のときに
みんなで五月さんの格好してたよね？
translation:
Come to think of it, you all dressed up as Itsuki-san
during the hot spring trip, right?

japanese:
誰が誰なのか全然わからなくて……
最初は五月さんが分裂しちゃったのかと思ったよ。
translation:
I had no idea who was who...
At first, I thought Itsuki-san had split
into other versions of herself.

japanese:
人間がどうやって分裂するんだ。
プラナリアじゃないんだぞ。
translation:
How do humans split into more versions of themselves?
They're not amoebas.

japanese:
だって、本当にソックリなんだもん。
見分けるなんて絶対に無理だよ。
translation:
It's just, they were the spitting image of each other!
It was impossible to tell them apart.

japanese:
くくく……。
俺はあの状態でも三玖を見分けられたぞ。
translation:
Hehehe... I could tell them apart and knew 
who Miku was, at that time.

japanese:
えっ、スゴい！
それってやっぱり愛があったから？
translation:
Woah, wow!
Is that because you liked her?

japanese: あっ……！
translation: Aah...!

japanese:
はぁ！？
きゅ、急に何を言い出すんだよ！？
translation:
WHA?!
Wh-what are you talking about, all of a sudden?!

japanese:
さっき三玖さんに教わったんだ。
変装してても愛があればわかるんだって。
translation:
I just heard it from Miku-san.
If you love the person behind the disguise, you can
see through it..

japanese:
それはこいつらの身内限定で……
おい、三玖もなんとか言って――
translation:
This only applies to relatives...
Come on, Miku, say something...

japanese: （こいつ答える気ないな！？）
translation: (She doesn't want to say anything at all?!)

japanese:
ねえねえ、お兄ちゃんが見分けられたのは、
やっぱり愛があるってことなんだよね？
translation:
It means that you're in love with Miku and could
tell her apart from the others right?

japanese: それは……。
translation: That's...

japanese:
愛じゃなくてコツだ！
こいつらを見分けるにはコツがあるんだよ。
translation:
It ain't love, I just got the hang of it!
There's a trick to tell them apart.

japanese: コツって？
translation: What's the trick?

japanese:
そ、そうだな、一番わかりやすいのは髪の長さだ。
他にも、髪飾りとか身につけている小物で
判別することもできる！
translation:
W-well, the most obvious thing is the length of
their hair. You can also identify them by
the accessories they wear, such as hair ornaments!

japanese: でも旅館のときは、同じ髪型で同じ格好だったよ？
translation:
But at the inn,
they had the same hairstyle, and wore the same 
clothes, right?

japanese:
う……確かにあのときは……
となると……雰囲気とか何気ない仕草とか……か？
translation:
Oooh... At that time, for sure...
Another trick for telling them apart is...their aura,
and the casual gestures they make...I guess?

japanese: それでわかっちゃうなんて、やっぱり愛なんだね～。
translation:
It's gotta be love if you can distinguish them with that
kind of information.

japanese:
そ、その話はこのくらいにして……
せっかくだしフータローも一緒に花火やろ？
translation:
Th-that's enough of that...
Futaro, why don't we set off some fireworks together?

japanese:
お、おう、せっかくだしな！
ほら、らいはも一緒に花火するぞ！
translation:
Oh, well, since the three of us are here!
Come on, Raiha, let's light some fireworks together!

japanese:
はーい。
まだ花火残ってるかな？
私、取ってくるね！
translation:
Okay.
We still have fireworks left, right?
I'll go get them!

japanese: 愛にも色々あるんだよ。
translation: There are various kinds of love, you know?

japanese: 色々って？
translation: Various kinds of love?

japanese:
ええと……家庭教師と生徒なんだから師弟愛か？
あとは友人としての愛とかあるだろ。
translation:
Umm... Since I'm their tutor, it could be a respectful 
teacher and student relationship, you know?
We also like each other as friends.

japanese: ふ～ん、そうなの？
translation: Hmm, is that so?

japanese: うん……。
translation: Yes...

japanese:
そういうことだ。
……もういいだろ？
translation:
That's what it is.
...Can we stop now?

japanese:
うんうん、なるほど。
じゃあ、そういうことにしておこうかな。
translation:
Fine, fine, I get it.
Let's leave it at that.

japanese:
そ、その話はこのくらいにして……
せっかくだしフータローも一緒に花火やろ？
translation:
Th-that's enough of that...
Futaro, why don't we set off some fireworks together?

japanese:
お、おう、せっかくだしな！
ほら、らいはも一緒に花火するぞ！
translation:
Oh, well, since the three of us are here!
Come on, Raiha, let's light some fireworks together!

japanese:
はーい。
まだ花火残ってるかな？
私、取ってくるね！
translation:
Okay.
We still have fireworks left, right?
I'll go get them!

japanese: なんとなくわかったんだ。
translation: I just kinda knew, that's all.

japanese: なんとなくって？
translation: You just knew?

japanese:
いや、自分でも説明ができないんだが、
あのときは、ふと思ったんだよ。
こいつは三玖なんじゃないかってな。
translation:
Well, I can't really explain it myself,
but I could tell them apart.
And I was able to identify Miku.

japanese: フータロー……。
translation: Futaro...

japanese:
そっかー、それを愛っていうんじゃないのかな？
ねっ、三玖さん？
translation:
That so? Well, I think that's the power of love, huh?
What do you say, Miku-san?

japanese: えっ……あ、あの……。
translation: Eh... U-um...

japanese:
あのボクネンジンだったお兄ちゃんが
そこまでわかるんだもん。
うん、やっぱり愛なんだよ！
translation:
Even a blockhead like big bro could tell it was you.
Yep, that's gotta be love!

japanese: あう……。
translation: Ahhh...

japanese:
そ、その話はこのくらいにして……
せっかくだしフータローも一緒に花火やろ？
translation:
Th-that's enough of that...
Futaro, why don't we set off some fireworks together?

japanese:
お、おう、せっかくだしな！
ほら、らいはも一緒に花火するぞ！
translation:
Oh, well, since the three of us are here!
Come on, Raiha, let's light some fireworks together!

japanese:
はーい。
まだ花火残ってるかな？
私、取ってくるね！
translation:
Okay.
We still have fireworks left, right?
I'll go get them!

japanese:
すまん、妙な話になっちまって。
らいはのやつ、少しはしゃぎすぎだな。
translation:
Sorry, that was a strange conversation.
Raiha got carried away.

japanese: ……妙な話なの？
translation: ...It was a strange conversation?

japanese: え？
translation: Huh?

japanese:
ううん、なんでもない。
らいはちゃんが楽しそうでよかった。
今年もみんなで花火を見に行こうね。
translation:
No, nothing. 
Raiha-chan looks like she's having a lot of fun.
Let's see some fireworks together this year, too.

japanese: あ、ああ、そうだな。
translation: Y-yeah, you're right.

japanese:
（今年は、あの打ち上げ花火を
　全員揃って見られるように祈っておくか……）
translation:
(I really hope we can
 go to that fireworks festival
 all together this year...)
